dialogues.text: I couldn't tell you. I still haven't figured out mine. I doubt I'm gonna win a Grammy .

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Who knows. DOUG draws in closer to HEATH. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 93 94 95 Fortune Cookie - 109.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I guess this would be type two.

dialogues.speaker: HEATH
dialogues.text: (nervously) Yeah. They continue to dance this way for a while.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: So what's type one like?

dialogues.speaker: HEATH
dialogues.text: I don't know. I think there's a law against siblings attempting it. DOUG burrows in closer--cheek to cheek or lips to ears no As they spin and we see DOUG'S face, he wears a sublime smile.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: You know what would be funny?

dialogues.speaker: HEATH
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: If, on Monday, we walked through the cafeteria holding hands.

dialogues.speaker: HEATH
dialogues.text: That would freak people out.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Yeah, I think it would.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAROLYN speeds towards DEAN'S house. She rehearses what s going to say.

dialogues.speaker: CAROLYN
dialogues.text: Dean, maybe we should think over this decision... Dean, let's not throw out the baby with the bathwater... Dean, I think I left some Tupperware over here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRENT gets some change out of his pocket. From the inside coat pocket of his jacket he pulls out an address book. H flips through the pages locating the correct number. He dials. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 95 96 Fortune Cookie - 110.

dialogues.speaker: TRENT
dialogues.text: Still be up. Still be up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BETH and AMANDA are dancing around the living room to "Ta Chance On Me." The phone rings. Beth turns the music way down. Amanda continues to dance behind Beth as she speaks the phone.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: TRENT
dialogues.text: Uh, hi, Beth. This is Trent.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: What's up?

dialogues.speaker: TRENT
dialogues.text: Listen, I wanted to call and tell you that I ..I don't know.. that I think you're swell.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Swell?

dialogues.speaker: TRENT
dialogues.text: And smart and funny and cynical. Mainly swell.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Uh, thanks.

dialogues.speaker: TRENT
dialogues.text: So what are you doing tomorrow?

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: (unsure) Studying. AMANDA has danced back over to the stereo and turned it u just in time for a repeat of the "Take a chance, Take a chance" chorus.

dialogues.speaker: BETH, (CONT.)
dialogues.text: (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, I'll probably be able to free up some time...

dialogues.speaker: TRENT
dialogues.text: That's great. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fortune Cookie - 111.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: if...

dialogues.speaker: TRENT
dialogues.text: Uh huh.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: wif you tell me what you're favorite movie is.

dialogues.speaker: TRENT
dialogues.text: (long beat) Ghandi.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: Ghandi?

dialogues.speaker: TRENT
dialogues.text: You asked.

dialogues.speaker: BETH
dialogues.text: You know what? That's so uncool, I think I believe you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAROLYN knocks on DEAN'S door. DEAN answers. The two there awkwardly for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: CAROLYN
dialogues.text: Marry me.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: CAROLYN
dialogues.text: Is that soup bowl of mine still here.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: You don't get to ask that question. It's mine. I bought a ring and everything. DEAN produces the ring.

dialogues.speaker: CAROLYN
dialogues.text: Have I spoiled the drama?

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: I'm still shaking. Carolyn, the backwards way I asked earlier--I deserved a no.

dialogues.speaker: CAROLYN
dialogues.text: Try again. 96 97 stand (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 97 98 Fortune Cookie - 112.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: Marry me.

dialogues.speaker: CAROLYN
dialogues.text: I can't think of a single reason not to. The two kiss joyfully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We return to GARRETT'S interview scene.

dialogues.speaker: GARRETT
dialogues.text: Call me jaded, but at least I know what my job is here. I'm not in the fortune business. I'm just supposed to provide a conversation piece for our customers. Not everybody gets it. I know this guy who swears by fortune cookies, because he got four out of six numbers on the lottery off a fortune cookie and won a few hundred bucks. If it were me, I'd wonder why the cookie didn't give me the other two digits. If anything I write ever does come true, it's because it's self-fulfilling. People believe what they want to believe. And most people want to believe in happy endings. (Long, long pause) Not me. I like it when endings are unapologetically grim. The hero gets committed to an asylum and his lover has to marry a drug lord to pay the bills. Now that's a finale. FADE TO BLACK.
